A Viral  $XRP Ledger Memo Sparked Confusion‚ÄîHere‚Äôs What Actually Happened
A memo attached to an #XRP Ledger escrow transaction circulated widely at the start of 2026, leading some to believe it was an official statement from Ripple about large XRP sales and future plans.

In reality, the memo was user-added, not authored by Ripple. On the XRPL, any account can submit an EscrowFinish transaction once an escrow unlocks, and the memo field is fully customizable. The escrow release itself followed Ripple‚Äôs standard schedule; the message attached to it carried no official authority.

The episode highlights a recurring issue: escrow releases do not equal market sales, and on-chain transparency still requires careful interpretation. The ledger worked as designed, what spread was misinformation, not a protocol signal.

Fedi to Go Open Source on Bitcoin Genesis Anniversary. Fedi will release its full software stack as open source on Jan. 3, completing a pledge made at launch in 2024.  The company said all Fedi software has now transitioned to the Affero General Public License (AGPL), following an interim period under a business source license.   The change makes Fedi‚Äôs codebase publicly available under a copyleft license that requires derivative works to remain open, according to a spokesperson from Fedi.   The date carries weight in Bitcoin history. Jan. 3 marks the anniversary of the Bitcoin genesis block, mined in 2009.
